Buttons

Use buttons to guide users towards completing a task. They should include text that describes the action they perform.

  1. Primary button
  2. Secondary button

1. Primary button

Try to restrict primary buttons to only one per page.

Action button
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-button [label]="'Pay now'" [isSecondary]="false" [onClick]="logClick" > </app-button>

Angular component:
                import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-button',
                    templateUrl: './button.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./button.component.scss']
})
export class ButtonComponent {

                    constructor() { }

  @Input() label: string;

  @Input() isSecondary: boolean;

  @Input() icon: string;

  @Input() onClick: () => any;

  handleClick() {
    this.onClick()
  }
}
Angular template:
                <button
    [class.secondary]="isSecondary === true"
    [class.icon]="icon"
    (click)="handleClick()"
>
    <p>
                    {{label}}
                    </p>
    <i *ngIf= "icon" class="fa {{icon}}"></i>
</button>

Icon button
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-button [label]="'Open folder'" [icon]="'fa-folder'" [isSecondary]="false" [onClick]="logClick" > </app-button>

Angular component:
                import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-button',
                    templateUrl: './button.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./button.component.scss']
})
export class ButtonComponent {

                    constructor() { }

  @Input() label: string;

  @Input() isSecondary: boolean;

  @Input() icon: string;

  @Input() onClick: () => any;

  handleClick() {
    this.onClick()
  }
}
Angular template:
                <button
    [class.secondary]="isSecondary === true"
    [class.icon]="icon"
    (click)="handleClick()"
>
    <p>
                    {{label}}
                    </p>
    <i *ngIf= "icon" class="fa {{icon}}"></i>
</button>

1. Secondary button

Use secondary buttons for more minor interactions, or if you need multiple buttons on a single page.

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-button [label]="Pay now" [isSecondary]="true" [onClick]="logClick" > </app-button>

Angular component:
                import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-button',
                    templateUrl: './button.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./button.component.scss']
})
export class ButtonComponent {

                    constructor() { }

  @Input() label: string;

  @Input() isSecondary: boolean;

  @Input() icon: string;

  @Input() onClick: () => any;

  handleClick() {
    this.onClick()
  }
}
Angular template:
                <button
    [class.secondary]="isSecondary === true"
    [class.icon]="icon"
    (click)="handleClick()"
>
    <p>
                    {{label}}
                    </p>
    <i *ngIf= "icon" class="fa {{icon}}"></i>
</button>

Icon button
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-button [label]="'Open folder'" [icon]="'fa-folder'" [isSecondary]="true" [onClick]="logClick" > </app-button>

Angular component:
                import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-button',
                    templateUrl: './button.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./button.component.scss']
})
export class ButtonComponent {

                    constructor() { }

  @Input() label: string;

  @Input() isSecondary: boolean;

  @Input() icon: string;

  @Input() onClick: () => any;

  handleClick() {
    this.onClick()
  }
}
Angular template:
                <button
    [class.secondary]="isSecondary === true"
    [class.icon]="icon"
    (click)="handleClick()"
>
    <p>
                    {{label}}
                    </p>
    <i *ngIf= "icon" class="fa {{icon}}"></i>
</button>
